MGDrivE 0.1.0
  • Reference

Inheritance Cube: Immunizing Reversal/Basic Reversal

Cube_ImmunizingReversalMF.Rd

This function creates an Immunizing Reversal construct, it has 5 alleles at 1 locus

  • W: Wild-type

  • H: Homing allele

  • E: Eraser allele

  • R: No-cost resistance allele

  • B: Detrimental resistance allele

  • eHWM: Rate of homing in males, W -> H transition

  • eEWM: Rate of homing in males, W -> E transition

  • eEHM: Rate of homing in males, H -> E transition

  • eHWF: Rate of homing in females, W -> H transition

  • eEWF: Rate of homing in females, W -> E transition

  • eEHF: Rate of homing in females, H -> E transition

  • rHWM: Generation of R alleles during homing in males, from H

  • bHWM: Generation of B alleles during homing in males, from H

  • rEWM: Generation of R alleles during homing in males, from E

  • bEWM: Generation of B alleles during homing in males, from E

  • rEHM: Generation of R alleles during homing in males, from E

  • bEHM: Generation of B alleles during homing in males, from E

  • rHWF: Generation of R alleles during homing in females, from H

  • bHWF: Generation of B alleles during homing in females, from H

  • rEWF: Generation of R alleles during homing in females, from E

  • bEWF: Generation of B alleles during homing in females, from E

  • rEHF: Generation of R alleles during homing in females, from E

  • bEHF: Generation of B alleles during homing in females, from E

Cube_ImmunizingReversalMF(eHWM = 1, eEWM = 1, eEHM = 1, eHWF = 1,
  eEWF = 1, eEHF = 1, rHWM = 0, bHWM = 0, rEWM = 0, bEWM = 0,
  rEHM = 0, bEHM = 0, rHWF = 0, bHWF = 0, rEWF = 0, bEWF = 0,
  rEHF = 0, bEHF = 0, eta = NULL, phi = NULL, omega = NULL,
  xiF = NULL, xiM = NULL, s = NULL)

Arguments

eHWM

Homing efficiency of drive allele in males
eEWM

Homing efficiency of IR allele into wild-type allele in males
eEHM

Homing efficiency of IR allele into homing allele in males
eHWF

Homing efficiency of drive allele into wild-type allele in females
eEWF

Homing efficiency of IR allele into wild-type allele in females
eEHF

Homing efficiency of IR allele into homing allele in females
rHWM

No-cost resistant allele generation rate in males, from H into W
bHWM

Detrimental resistant allele genration rate in males, from H into W
rEWM

No-cost resistant allele generation rate in males, from E into W
bEWM

Detrimental resistant allele generation rate in males, from E into W
rEHM

No-cost resistant allele generation rate in males, from E into H
bEHM

Detrimental resistant allele generation rate in males, from E into H
rHWF

No-cost resistant allele generation rate in females, from H into W
bHWF

Detrimental resistant allele genration rate in females, from H into W
rEWF

No-cost resistant allele generation rate in females, from E into W
bEWF

Detrimental resistant allele generation rate in females, from E into W
rEHF

No-cost resistant allele generation rate in females, from E into H
bEHF

Detrimental resistant allele generation rate in females, from E into H
eta

Genotype-specific mating fitness
phi

Genotype-specific sex ratio at emergence
omega

Genotype-specific multiplicative modifier of adult mortality
xiF

Genotype-specific female pupatory success
xiM

Genotype-specific male pupatory success
s

Genotype-specific fractional reduction(increase) in fertility

Value

Named list containing the inheritance cube, transition matrix, genotypes, wild-type allele, and all genotype-specific parameters.

Details

This is the general form for an immunizing reversal drive. If the eEWM and eEWF are 0, and the other (r/b)EW(M/F) parameters are 0, then this simplifies to a basic reversal drive.This drive handles different male and female homing rates, signifying differential expression from an autosome.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Details
